p: Except 2 extracts, the other tested EtOAc extracts did not show potent inhibitory activity for alpha-amylase. The most promising inhibitory activity was shown by the EtOAc extract of Fissidens sp.; therefore, this is a valuable finding, and the extract can be used to isolate respective active metabolites since isolation of antialpha-amylase compounds from lower plants is very rare. Furthermore, alpha-amylase inhibitory activity represents in vitro antidiabetic activity. Hence, these active extracts are useful to regulate blood glucose levels and act as postprandial glucose regulators. There are only few studies on alpha-amylase inhibitory activity of bryophytes, and this study is one of them.
